text_en: 6C4x.60 Substance-induced psychotic disorder with hallucinations • All diagnostic requirements for substance-induced psychotic disorder are met. • The presentation is characterized by hallucinations that are judged to be the direct consequence of the use of or withdrawal from a specified substance or medication. • Neither delusions nor other psychotic symptoms are present. • The symptoms do not occur exclusively during hypnogogic or hypnopompic states.
